information_for_contributors: This file has been converted from https://github.com/Shopify/ruby-lsp/blob/master/vscode/grammars/ruby.cson.json
If you want to provide a fix or improvement, please create a pull request against the original repository.
Once accepted there, we are happy to receive an update request.
name: Ruby

patterns.comment: else if is a common mistake carried over from other languages. it works if you put in a second end, but itâ€™s never what you want.
patterns.name: invalid.deprecated.ruby

patterns.comment: A local variable and/or assignment in a condition
A local variable operation assignment in a condition
A local variable assignment in a condition
everything being a reserved word, not a value and needing a 'end' is a..
patterns.name: keyword.control.ruby

patterns.comment: contextual smart pair support for block parameters
patterns.name: keyword.control.start-block.ruby

patterns.comment: everything being a method but having a special function is a..
patterns.name: keyword.other.special-method.ruby

patterns.comment: The method pattern comes from the symbol pattern. See there for an explanation.
patterns.name: meta.function.method.with-arguments.ruby

patterns.begin:
(?x)
(?=def\b)                          # optimization to help Oniguruma fail fast
(?<=^|\s)(def)\s+
(
  (?>[a-zA-Z_]\w*(?>\.|::))?      # method prefix
  (?>                               # method name
    [a-zA-Z_]\w*(?>[?!]|=(?!>))?
    |
    ===?|!=|>[>=]?|<=>|<[<=]?|[%&`/\|]|\*\*?|=?~|[-+]@?|\[]=?
  )
)
[ \t]
(?=[ \t]*[^\s#;])                 # make sure the following is not comment
patterns.comment: same as the previous rule, but without parentheses around the arguments
patterns.name: meta.function.method.with-arguments.ruby

patterns.comment: the optional name is just to catch the def also without a method-name
patterns.name: meta.function.method.without-arguments.ruby

patterns.comment: Needs higher precedence than regular expressions.
patterns.name: keyword.operator.assignment.augmented.ruby

patterns.comment: string literal with interpolation and "" delimiter
patterns.name: string.quoted.double.interpolated.ruby

patterns.comment: Cant be named because its not necessarily an escape.
Cant be named because its not necessarily an escape.
Cant be named because its not necessarily an escape.
Cant be named because its not necessarily an escape.

matches questionmark-letters.

			examples (1st alternation = hex):
			?\x1     ?\x61

			examples (2nd alternation = octal):
			?\0      ?\07     ?\017

			examples (3rd alternation = escaped):
			?\n      ?\b

			examples (4th alternation = meta-ctrl):
			?\C-a    ?\M-a    ?\C-\M-\C-\M-a

			examples (4th alternation = normal):
			?a       ?A       ?0 
			?*       ?"       ?( 
			?.       ?#
			
			
			the negative lookbehind prevents against matching
			p(42.tainted?)
patterns.name: constant.numeric.ruby

patterns.comment: heredoc with multiple inputs and indented terminator
Mark as namespace separator if double colons followed by capital letter
Mark as method separator if double colons not followed by capital letter
Must come after method and constant separators to prefer double colons
patterns.name: punctuation.separator.other.ruby

patterns.comment: We are restrictive in what we allow to go after the comment character to avoid false positives, since the availability of comments depend on regexp flags.
patterns.name: comment.line.number-sign.ruby

yard_see.comment: separate rule for @see because name could contain url
yard_see.name: comment.line.number-sign.ruby

yard_macro_attribute.comment: separate rule for attribute and macro tags because name goes after []
yard_macro_attribute.name: comment.line.number-sign.ruby

yard_comment.comment: For YARD tags that follow the tag-comment pattern
yard_comment.name: comment.line.number-sign.ruby

yard_param_types.comment: For YARD tags that follow the tag-name-types-description or tag-types-name-description pattern
yard_param_types.name: comment.line.number-sign.ruby

yard_option.comment: For YARD option tag that follow the tag-name-types-key-(value)-description pattern
yard_option.name: comment.line.number-sign.ruby

yard_tag.comment: For YARD tags that are just the tag
yard_tag.name: comment.line.number-sign.ruby

yard_types.comment: For YARD tags that follow the tag-types-comment pattern
yard_types.name: comment.line.number-sign.ruby
